strats.name: Leave With Runway, Super Blocks Cleared
strats.note: All 3 Super blocks must be broken for this longer runway to be usable.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave Shinecharged (Short Runway)
Leave With Controlled Spring Ball Bounce (Super Blocks Broken)
Leave With Controlled Spring Ball Bounce (Super Blocks Broken, Door Open)
Come in Shinecharged, Leave With Spark
Kraid Entrance Wiggle
strats.note: This strat makes it possible to squeeze through Morphless with just 2 supers.

strats.name: Kraid Entrance Squeeze
strats.note: Use 2 supers, then squeeze through with a spin jump or down-aim jump.

strats.name: Kraid Exit Wiggle
strats.note: Shoot out the bottom two super blocks and crouch-wiggle through.

strats.name: Kraid Exit Squeeze
strats.note: Use 2 supers, then squeeze through with a spin jump or down-aim jump.

strats.name: Jump Over the Pit
strats.note: Break all 3 super blocks to build enough run speed to jump over the pit.

strats.name: Kraid Entrance Walljump
strats.note: It's much easier without Speedbooster equipped.
strats.devNote: With Speedbooster and without canDisableEquipment, the player would use the canTrickyDashJump strat.

strats.name: Kraid Entrance Speedjump
note: Run along the bottom of the pit to build speed for a speedy jump.
Only run 7.5 tiles left to right. If done optimally, no wall jump is required.

strats.name: Spring Ball
strats.note: Use Springball as a movement item to reach the Kraid Mouth ledge by jumping from the elevator runway, or by jumping from below.
strats.devNote: By reaching 4, the super wall has been broken enough to fit in morph.

strats.name: Use Flash Suit
strats.note: To save energy, jump from the runway by the Super blocks. This is doable with less than 29 Energy.

strats.name: Warehouse Entrance Arm Pump Jump
note: Back up against the wall of the single-tile ledge.
Run forward, perform a single arm pump, and jump on the last possible frame.
Aim down just before reaching the platform.
The arm pump can be performed by pressing shot, or by pressing an angle button (but not releasing it until after the jump).

strats.name: Zeela Farm
devNote: FIXME: Node 3 could be used to reset the room, with additional requirements.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Zeela
Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Spark
note: Gain a shinecharging while entering the room, and angle diagonally down to shoot the block.
While falling, kill the Zeela or perform a Kago through it.
Quickly reach the door below and spark out.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharged, Leave With Spark
note: Enter with a shinecharge, jumping and aiming down and shoot the block.
While falling, kill the Zeela or perform a Kago through it.
Quickly reach the door below and spark out.
devNote: FIXME: Add faster strat that morphs and takes a neutral damage boost off the Zeela and then down-backs.

strats.name: Very Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb
note: Enter with G-mode direct, back up to between 1 and 6 pixels from the door transition, and activate X-ray to get very deep stuck in the door.
The camera will be messed up, so you will need to move blindly to get into position.
Don't wait too long or the Zeela will hit you.
Climb up 1 screen, and perform a turnaround buffered spin-jump away from the door to trigger the transition, bypassing any lock on the door.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Spark
note: Enter with a shinecharge, and move up toward the door above.
Use Wave or Plasma to shoot open the door from below while killing the approaching Zeelas.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharged, Leave With Spark
note: Enter with a shinecharge, and move up toward the door above.
Use Wave or Plasma to shoot open the door from below while killing the approaching Zeelas.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Zeela
Warehouse Zeela Ice Moonfall Leave with Stored Fall Speed
note: Freeze two Zeelas, one on the left wall below the top door platform, and one on the right wall between 1 and 2 tiles lower, both moving downward;
Kill the third Zeela.
Go to the bottom of the room, unequip ice to thaw the Zeelas, synchronizing their movement.
Freeze the right Zeela after it turns past the single-tile ledge, with its top level with or slightly above the ledge;
then freeze the left Zeela just before it turns the corner above.
Quickly moonfall between them, and shoot the bottom Zeela (or slide past its edge) just before it thaws.
If successful, Samus will clip down through two tiles and end up crouching.
Press forward to stand, then perform another moonfall away from the wall to clip down further.
Finally, use grapple to escape from the floor.
strats.devNote: The fall speed stored is between 1 and 2 tiles.

strats.name: Temporary Blue Bounce (Come in Shinecharging)
strats.devNote: The runway has 1 unusable tile, to allow space to perform the blue bounce.

strats.name: Temporary Blue Bounce (Come in With Temporary Blue)
Stored Moonfall Clip
strats.note: Moonfall to clip into the ground and then spinjump up from the ground to break the Bomb block using Screw Attack.

strats.name: Warehouse Zeela Ice Moonfall Screw Attack Clip
note: Freeze two Zeelas, one on the left wall below the top door platform, and one on the right wall between 1 and 2 tiles lower, both moving downward;
Kill the third Zeela.
Go to the bottom of the room, unequip ice to thaw the Zeelas, synchronizing their movement.
Freeze the right Zeela after it turns past the single-tile ledge, with its top level with or slightly above the ledge;
then freeze the left Zeela just before it turns the corner above.
Quickly moonfall between them, and shoot the bottom Zeela (or slide past its edge) just before it thaws.
If successful, Samus will clip down through two tiles and end up crouching.
Press forward to stand, then perform another moonfall to clip down further, breaking the bomb block with Screw Attack.
Unmorph and morph once or twice if needed to get unstuck from the floor.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Overload PLMs
strats.note: Wiggle back and forth to get through the bomb blocks before the Zeela hits Samus.
strats.devNote: This is off camera, but doesnt require canOffScreenMovement because of its simplicity.

strats.name: Temporary Blue Spring Ball Bounce (X-Ray Turnaround)
G-Mode Morph Overload PLMs
note: Wiggle back and forth to get through the bomb blocks while avoiding the off screen Zeela.
Unmorph and exit G-Mode then quickly run back and forth to fix the camera or go through the door.

strats.name: Zeela Ice Clip Door Lock Skip
note: Freeze a Zeela at a precise distance below the door in order to jump up and clip through the door shell.
The pixel window is larger and higher with Morph and an X-Ray stand-up.
strats.devNote: FIXME: This could use an obstacle, so that it can be broken other ways, such as with screw or a speed ball.

strats.name: Beetom Farm
strats.note: Kill the Beetoms with Screw Attack or by freezing or carefully avoiding them and using Bombs or Power Bombs.
devNote: Health Bomb ends at 50 energy.
One ammo can be used to gain a power bomb and then power bombs can be used to farm more power bombs.

strats.name: Leave With Runway - Single Frozen Beetom
strats.note: Freeze a single Beetom to extend the runway. Freeze any Beetoms that latch onto Samus to minimize taking damage.

strats.name: Warehouse Energy Tank Frozen Beetom Runway
note: Freeze multiple Beetoms to extend the runway. Continually refreeze the ones that are in a good position while manipulating the rest.
This assumes three extra tiles of runway, which can be accomplished with two perfectly placed Beetoms, three adjacent ones, or four which are partially overlapping.

strats.name: 10 Power Bomb Crystal Flash
strats.devNote: Resetting the room could be required to farm a bit of energy to get above health-bomb range, to ensure a Power Bomb drop.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Beetom
Tricky Evade
note: Wait by the door briefly before spin jumping over and grabbing the item.
It is also possible to do this instead by entering with run speed and quickly grabbing the item.

strats.name: Shinespark
strats.devNote: Sparking into the room through the middle of the door also works.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Kill the Beetoms
strats.note: Roll in while avoiding the Beetoms. It is possible to kill them all without getting hit; one of the most safe areas is the center of the lower floor.
devNote: There is no way to avoid all damage in direct g-mode, nor a way to get out of immobile.
It is technically possible but very precise to kill them with a Power Bomb entering with 4 energy and both suits.

81.name: Warehouse Kihunter Room

strats.name: Shinespark
strats.devNote: This strat is not useful in-room, but can satisfy a strat in the room before with an exit shinespark.

strats.name: Leave Shinecharged (Open Door, Shot Block Intact)
Leave Shinecharged (Open Door, Shot Block Broken)
G-Mode Regain Mobility
strats.devNote: It looks like the only way to remain in the room is by starting on the right side and triggering a turnaround, with or without artificial morph.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Overload PLMs
strats.note: Overload the PLMs by rolling through the camera scroll blocks which are just above the shot blocks.
strats.devNote: In immobile, the Kihunters are in a worse location, but Samus starts with i-frames.

strats.name: Tricky Dodge
note: Jump between the kihunters to avoid damage.
To kill the kihunters, shoot them as they come on screen.
devNote: This strat can avoid the kihunters well enough to reach further nodes or it can kill them.
In both cases tricky dodging and accurate shooting is used.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: The Kihunters can be killed from below but there is a chance one will drop down the hole.  Watch them before breaking the shot block.

strats.name: Crouch Jump Down Grab
note: This crouch jump down grab is a little tighter than most.
The Kihunters can be killed from below but there is a chance one will drop down the hole. Watch them before breaking the shot block.

strats.name: Damage Boost
note: Use a kihunter to knock Samus out of the hole at the peak of her jump
This strat may take a few attempts to get a good boost.

strats.name: Warehouse Kihunter Room X-Ray Climb
strats.note: Climb up 1 screen

strats.name: Leave With Temporary Blue (Spring Ball Bounce)
note: Gain temporary blue by running left to right.
Spring ball bounce through the tunnel.
Then continue chaining temporary blue through the door.

strats.name: Block Already Broken
strats.note: The Kihunters can be killed by retreating to the morph tunnel if needed.

strats.name: Bomb the Block
strats.note: The Kihunters can be killed by retreating to the morph tunnel if needed.

strats.name: Power Bomb the Block
note: The Kihunters can be killed by retreating to the morph tunnel if needed.
Placing the Power Bomb far to the left will also destroy the shot blocks going down.

strats.name: Speedball (Come in Getting Blue Speed)
strats.note: The Kihunters can be killed by retreating to the morph tunnel if needed.
devNote: There is 1 unusable tile in this runway.
This can also work at higher run speeds, at least up to $2.A, but this is more difficult and the usable runway would be less.

strats.name: Speedball (Come in Blue Spinning)
strats.note: The Kihunters can be killed by retreating to the morph tunnel if needed.

strats.name: Temporary Blue Spring Ball Bounce
note: Approach the morph tunnel by chaining temporary blue; then spring ball bounce through the tunnel to break the bomb block.
The Kihunters can be killed by retreating to the morph tunnel if needed.

strats.name: Blue Spring Ball Bounce
note: Spring ball bounce directly into the tunnel to break the bomb block with blue speed.
The Kihunters can be killed by retreating to the morph tunnel if needed.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Overload PLMs
note: Rolling on the ground will overload PLMs by moving through camera scroll blocks.
Lure all of the Kihunters to the top right position, then quickly move left, exit g-mode and retreat to one of the other exits.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: Reaching 4 means obstacle B is open.

strats.name: Leave Shinecharged (Closed Door, Shot Block Intact)
strats.note: Use the door for additional runway then open it once the Shinecharge is complete.
devNote: It could be useful to have a proper way to represent that this strat requires the door not to be open.
If it were a locked red or green door, you would not be able to unlock it as part of this strat unless you could reset the room.

strats.name: Leave Shinecharged (Closed Door, Shot Block Broken)
strats.note: Use the door for additional runway then open it once the Shinecharge is complete.
devNote: It could be useful to have a proper way to represent that this strat requires the door not to be open.
If it were a locked red or green door, you would not be able to unlock it as part of this strat unless you could reset the room.

strats.name: Warehouse Kihunter Room Bottom Spark Out
strats.note: Charge a spark, then break the shot blocks, drop through, and spark out the bottom right door.

strats.name: Warehouse Kihunter Room Bottom Leave Shinecharged
strats.note: Break the shot block, then gain a shinecharge while sliding off the ledge, down toward the bottom right door.

strats.name: Power Bomb the Block
strats.note: Placing the Power Bomb against the right wall will not break the shot blocks going down.

strats.name: Warehouse Kihunter Speedball
note: A very low horizontal speed is needed to drop down and break the block without hitting the corner to the left or the block above the bomb block.
Or with Temporary Blue, Samus can bounce into the bomb block.

strats.name: Warehouse Kihunter Room Tunnel Charge (Shot Block Intact)
strats.note: Generate a charge on the left side and carry it through the morph tunnel and out the right door.

strats.name: Warehouse Kihunter Room Tunnel Charge (Shot Block Broken)
strats.note: Generate a charge on the left side and carry it through the morph tunnel and out the right door.

devNote: FIXME: An ice moonfall might be possible to clip past the bottom left door shell?
FIXME: Leaving with temporary blue through the bottom door (node 2) is possible but seems really bad.

strats.name: Kill the Enemies
strats.devNote: Power Bombs only sometimes work on mini kraid for some reason.

strats.name: Tank the Damage
strats.note: Quickly run through to tank the Pirate (or its laser) and one of Mini-Kraid's spikes.

strats.name: Speedbooster Dodge Kill
note: Shoot the pirates to prevent their lasers, then jump over them to get to the runway.
Mini-Kraid spikes will block the runway fairly quickly; a shortcharge can allow for more run space but isn't required.
strats.devNote: You have to move somewhat quickly to not need a shortcharge.

strats.name: Dodge
strats.note: Shoot the pirates to prevent their lasers, then jump over them. Tank one Mini-Kraid spike.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Bomb or Power Bomb Kill
note: Wait for the pirates to move as far right as possible in order to kill them all with a single Power Bomb.
Unmorph and kill Baby Kraid before exiting G-Mode. Run away, exit G-Mode, then jump over the spike projectiles.

strats.name: Enemies Already Killed
strats.devNote: Power Bombs only sometimes work on mini kraid for some reason.

strats.name: Speed Kill
strats.note: Gain Iframes by taking damage then run left to create enough space to run back to the right with speedbooster.

strats.name: Pacifist
strats.note: Wait to hit one of Mini-Kraid's spikes, then run through.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Bomb Kill
note: Kill all of the enemies with Bombs. Samus will take a Baby Kraid spike hit while rolling through the invisible projectiles.
It is not too difficult to IBJ and then bomb horizontally over the cluster of invisible spikes, but there is some risk because they are invisible.
They occupy a slightly smaller space than what Baby Kraid was occupying.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Power Bomb Kill
note: Wait on the right side of Baby Kraid for about 10 seconds so that he shoots the maximum amount of projectiles which will move to the right after exiting G-Mode.
Roll through him and kill the left pirates with a Power Bomb. Only one is necessary when placing next to the pirate when it is as far to the left as possible.
Unmorph, freely kill Baby Kraid, then exit G-Mode. The his projectiles should all shoot to the right.
strats.devNote: FIXME: It should be possible to use a second Power Bomb or Spring Ball to hit one of Kraids invisible projectiles to save Energy.

strats.name: Green Pirates and Mini-Kraid Farm
strats.devNote: These two farms are combined, to allow an option of using using Supers farmed from Mini-Kraid to kill the Pirates.

strats.name: Leave With Runway - Frozen Zeb
note: With Morph: Morph on the small ledge left of the Zeb spawner. After a Zeb starts moving horizontally, quickly unmorph and freeze it.
After it thaws, refreeze it once it is in the correct position.
Without Morph: Freeze the Zeb as it is rising. When it is close to thawing, walk into the spikes and continue to walk into the wall to prevent a vertical damage boost.
Freeze the Zeb after it thaws, noting that it will rise one pixel relative to its first frozen location.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Zeb
Carry Shinecharge
note: Use quick ledge-grabs to reach the door in time.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharged, Leave With Spark (HiJump)
Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue
Come in Shinecharging, Leave with Spark
note: Gain a shinecharge while running into the room, sliding off the ledge, then jump to the center of the room.
Fire a shot to open the door, jump over the pillar, and spark out of the room.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharged, Leave with Spark
note: Run and jump to the center of the room.
Fire a shot to open the door, jump over the pillar, and spark out of the room.

strats.name: Hero Shot Spark
note: Run and jump, fire a shot mid-air, and activate the shinespark wind-up.
Wait until the shot is at a specific position before sparking.
Sparking too late will cause the shot to despawn before reaching the door.
Sparking too early will cause Samus to bonk the door as it will not yet be open.
A beam shot, Missile, or Super can be used.

strats.name: Leave With Mockball (Space Jump, Door Open)
Leave With Spring Ball Bounce (Space Jump, Door Open)
Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue
strats.note: Tank one or more ceiling thorn hits in order to make it past the middle section.
devNote: Entirely avoiding the thorn hits is technically possible but extremely difficult.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue
Leave With Runway - Frozen Zeb
note: Stand to the right of the Zeb farm then freeze the Zeb while it is still moving upward. Go to the top door and wait for the Zeb to arrive.
Freeze it at the correct height, then drop below it and wait for it to thaw. Freeze it again in the correct horizontal position.
Keep a half-tile gap between the Zeb and the runway to extend the runway as much as possible.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Zeb
note: Lure a Zeb up from below by freezing it or quickly moving after the Zeb has spawned, but before it becomes visible.
Note that Samus must start on the right side of the Zeb in order for it to move rightwards once it starts moving horizontally.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue
strats.note: Tank one or more ceiling thorn hits in order to make it past the middle section.
devNote: Entirely avoiding the thorn hits is technically possible but extremely difficult.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharged, Leave with Spark
note: Run and jump to the center of the room and over the pillar.
Fire a shot and activate the shinespark wind-up.
Wait until the shot hits the door before sparking.

strats.name: Hero Shot Spark
note: Run and jump, fire a shot mid-air, and activate the shinespark wind-up.
Wait until the shot is at a specific position before sparking.
Sparking too late will cause the shot to despawn before reaching the door.
Sparking too early will cause Samus to bonk the door as it will not yet be open.
A beam shot, Missile, or Super can be used.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue
strats.note: Tank one or more ceiling thorn hits in order to make it past the middle section.
devNote: Entirely avoiding the thorn hits is technically possible but extremely difficult.
Farming in the middle of the strat could also be possible.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue
strats.note: Tank one or more ceiling thorn hits in order to make it past the middle section.
devNote: Entirely avoiding the thorn hits is technically possible but extremely difficult.
Farming in the middle of the strat could also be possible.

strats.name: Leave With Runway - Frozen Zeb
note: With Morph: Morph on the small ledge right of the Zeb spawner. After a Zeb starts moving horizontally, quickly unmorph and freeze it.
After it thaws, refreeze it once it is in the correct position.
Without Morph: Freeze the Zeb as it is rising. When it is close to thawing, walk into the spikes and continue to walk into the wall to prevent a vertical damage boost.
Freeze the Zeb after it thaws, noting that it will rise one pixel relative to its first frozen location.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Zeb
strats.note: Lure a Zeb by freezing it or by moving quickly while carefully preventing it from going off screen.

strats.name: Leave Shinecharged
strats.devNote: An X-Mode strat is likely possible but not included. It would require the doors unlocked and canRiskPermanentLossOfAccess.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Kraid's Talons
note: The only projectiles that Kraid can hit Samus with through the transition are the spinning talons after he stands up.
This requires Kraid to not be defeated and the door to be open during the second phase.

strats.name: Carry Grapple Teleport (Top Position, Kraid Alive)
Leave Shinecharged
strats.devNote: An X-Mode strat is likely possible but not included. It would require the doors unlocked and canRiskPermanentLossOfAccess.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: You can actually do the Kraid fight normally if entering from the right door, but it will put Samus into the thorns.

strats.name: Prepared with Space Jump
strats.note: Being prepared and space jumping through the room can prevent a thorn hit.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: Door is reachable mid-fight but locked

strats.name: Base
strats.note: Door is not reachable mid-fight

strats.name: 10 Power Bomb Crystal Flash
strats.note: In quick succession, place a Power Bomb, refill at the refill station, then morph and Crystal Flash.
devNote: This strat does not work in vanilla, and only works if Missile refill stations also refill Supers and Power Bombs.
This is applicable in this room because this also refills Reserve Tanks, unlike the Energy refill station.
